meanings.definition: Of or relating to the administration of justice or the function of a judge.
meanings.sent1: The juridic system ensures fair trials for all.
meanings.sent2: Her juridic expertise was evident in the courtroom.
meanings.sent3: The juridic penguin held a mock trial for the fish thief.
meanings.sent4: His words carried a juridic weight that silenced the room.
meanings.sent5: The juridic robes of the judge billowed as he entered the court.

meanings.definition: Involving or concerned with legal matters or the law.
meanings.sent1: The company sought juridic advice before signing the contract.
meanings.sent2: Her juridic knowledge helped her navigate the complex legal system.
meanings.sent3: The juridic squirrel was known for suing other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The juridic implications of the case were far-reaching.
meanings.sent5: He had a juridic mind that could dissect any legal argument.
